cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 miles SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, then turning northwest toward the North Carolina / South Carolina border coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear, North Carolina (Wilmington/Southport area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge & Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC; Tropical-storm Watch north of NC/VA border to Cape Charles Light VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane & Storm-Surge Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina and North Carolina coastline, especially between South Santee River SC and Duck NC; inland sections of the Carolinas and southern Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (34–45 kt) possible late Friday into Saturday if Florence’s wind field expands southward
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation around 1–2 ft possible on the Georgia barrier islands due to long-period swells
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible, locally higher if rainbands extend southward
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents will affect vessel approaches and pilot boarding areas through the weekend
